title: Feedback: new client needs to be optimized, like really really badly.
body:
50% cpu usage on an i5 4690? yeah that makes sense.

the old client couldnt even break 10% cpu usage on my cpu.

or to drive it in further, the client is currently using 31% cpu usage while its idling in the background.

The actual game itself is only using 20%

Like i know riot is famous for their spaghetti code, but come on.

Further more i didnt have this problem while the client was in alpha, so something changed

replies.body: it made me dodge a promo so yeah booooo
I advise utilizing the Legacy Client if you're experiencing performance issues with the Beta Client.

It's an acknowledged problem.

If Riot is known to be good at anything, it's optimisation, because LoL takes like 0 power to run and I wouldn't be surprised if someone manages to run it with toasters somewhere.

Chances are, it will be sorted out significantly prior to official launch. 

But yes, the beta client's current performance is very, so very bad. But you could switch back to the legacy client for the meantime however.
Optimization is being worked on currently and Riot stated that by the time they're ready to officially launch the Beta Client, it'll utilize less resources than the Legacy Client.
Riot is continuously optimizing the Beta Client. While there is still a long ways to go, utilizing the Legacy Client until the Beta Client is optimized some more might be a wise choice.
